{{disambig-two|the mailing list about [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s [[languages]]|the Elven Loremasters|[[Lambengolmor]]}}
'''Lambengolmor''' was a mailing list for the scholarly study and discussion of the invented languages of Tolkien, launched by [[Carl F. Hostetter]] of the [[Elvish Linguistic Fellowship|E.L.F.]] on [[29 May]] [[2002]].

With the shut down of [http://ph.help.yahoo.com/kb/yahoo-groups-shut-sln35505.html?redirect=true Yahoo Groups] in [[15 December]] [[2020]], the group was closed. Carl Hostetter announced that it would reopen as a forum on the E.L.F website and that official archives would be made available<ref>{{webcite|author=[[Carl F. Hostetter]]|articleurl=https://tolkienlistsearch.herokuapp.com/message/5e9c3605acad32fd587a3ad0|articlename=The Future of the Lambengolmor List|dated=2019-12-08|website=Lambengolmor (Tolkien List Search Archive)|accessed=2022-09-22}}</ref> but neither has happened so far. An archive was made available by Harri Perälä though (see below).
